title: Auto Fill
body:
Please remove it or lower the player threshold to activate it. Right now it's on all day and people are constantly filled into roles they cannot play, in ranked.

I've even seen someone filled into jg, when they went top mid pref, while I was filled into mid when I went jg top pref, in the same game. So it seems to be a rather odd autofill system anyway.

I would much rather wait 20 minutes for a game that is winnable, than 5 minutes for a game that is just going to be a slam fest of people having little to no experience in the role they're forced into.

replies.body: Everyone playing ranked should be preparired to play all roles no excused scrubs.

It's not me i'm worried about, it's other players that worry me. A majority of players have no real interest in becoming proficient at more than one thing in this game. Most of them want to play a game of League with their favourite champion/role and then go maybe play some CoD/Civ/Rimworld/Overwatch/Whatever, and in that sense, if they are thrown into something they don't want to play, or can't, they are just going to troll, play badly and etc.. Ruining the game potentially for 4 other people.

Earnest players will learn all they can, more casual league players who (oddly) decide to play ranked games, are the issue here, in low elo, since this is the only elo it matters, and is the only elo in this regard where it hinders progression/climbing. As far as I know, higher elo players tend to wait awhile for games anyway, no matter the time of day?

what they should have is you are able to declare a single role you can't play only 1 the rest you may be autofilled into, most people know 2-3 roles max expecting someone to know all 5 in ranked and perform to their best is a bit harsh as if they get autofilled and don't know that role but know the other 4 they're most likely to under perform and this does affect their ranking

They tested this on LAN and LAS (both servers larger than ours) for a while, but It resulted in queue times 30 mins and upward and essentially destroyed queue health so was scrapped. It's one of those things that sounds great in theory but doesn't work out in practice.

It's less a matter of knowing all 5 roles and more a matter of knowing at least your two main roles and support. Top and Mid are the two most sought after roles atm (though it changes a bit from season to season) so someone queuing as top/mid can expected to see autofill a lot, because there is a high saturation of top/mid players and a low saturation of jng and very low of support.

Autofill is still preferable to the old system of first come first serve with pick order, where you were far less likely to get a role you wanted than you are now.

Where is this 75% number coming from? A 30 minute queue is a massive barrier of entry for a significant number of people (i.e anyone with work, school, or general significantly time consuming life related obligations), which is why Riot has decided not to accept such a long queue time in exchange.

If you're basing that on what you see here, then it's worth remembering that most people come to boards because they have a perceived problem, so those who are content with how things work are rarely seen here. 

Even if you put that aside, for every person saying they would take a 30 min queue to get a role they want, there is someone else complaining about the length of queues and how it is preventing them from playing ranked, and that is with the current system.

It varies from person to person, I would much rather play ADC, my weakest role but one that I still have a champ I am semi comfortable with (MF or Jinx) than wait an hour in queue to get my main role. And I say an hour because both LAN and LAS have higher populations that OCE, and both were seeing 30+ min queues (when there was only ONE ranked queue) with that option active, so you can imagine how this would be worse on OCE.

We couldn't have supported such an option with only one ranked queue, and now we have to support two there is just no way it's going to happen.

Support isn't a bad role, but the community perception has perpetually pushed it out of favour, and I doubt you'd find many people who would agree with say, removing the role, so clearly it has some value to them.

You're not wrong, but it isn't something where we can just flip a magic switch. It's still vastly preferably to the old system where you were forced to learn ALL roles because the randomised pick order generally determined who got what role.

Yet they won't replace our blind pick with auto fill enabled draft? seems a bit draft, considering that's all blind pick is anyway, actually it's worse because you can get 4 jglers who don't know or have any interest in playing anything else, and they all get placed in everything but jungle =P

Honestly, I don't think Rito cares about magic switches or anything, we're a small server so they don't really care to fix things to suit our population and playerbase.

Draft pick is being removed from all regions, so tl;dr we are never going to see it on OCE. The impact it had on queue stability was just too high.

That said, we will likely see the integration of NCS (New Champion Select) into blind pick sometime in the future, meaning we will be able to pick roles. Of course there are no guarantees of this, but given the direction they seem to be moving, I feel it is more a matter of 'when' than it is 'if'.

Blind pick is not autofill enabled draft. Draft pick involves bans, pick order, and seeing what champions the enemy picks (and takes so very much longer to get through). Blind pick is none of those things.

I've said it before and I'll say it again, OCE does not get shafted because we are smaller. If anything we get MORE attention. Us not having the population to support a queue like permanent Twisted Treeline does not mean Riot hates us, it means there are not physically enough people playing on our server to support that queue.

We get patches first, we have the same main queues (flex, solo/duo, normals, ARAM) as every other server, we get all the same RGMs, we have our own yearly event that over the last two years has given us an artificial reef and the beginnings of a wall of summoner names which no other server gets.

I didn't say Blind pick was auto fill draft, I said Draft with Auto Fill is basically blind pick. In the sense that someone will always get shafted into something they don't want to play, however, with blind pick it's worse, it's potentially 4 people will get thrown into roles they do not want to play, sure that's worst case scenario, but it's a possible scenario.

Yes, Draft has bans and a wait time, but half the time I sit through dodges in blind picks which amount to 4-5 entire draft pick durations. So I don't really see the issue/difference in the end (outside of people having their picks banned by trolls).

Yes it might be hyperbole that we get ignored, but I don't think i've seen any real responses to OCE posters about these issues.


So basically, they are implementing draft autofill but without the ban phase? (ie. this NCS you speak of, never heard anything about it)

In the end, I still don't understand how autofill now being on 24 hours a day, is acceptable, it's gotten worse as the season has progressed a little and most of the early season rankers have teetered off a bit.

I suppose there's a lot of factors that go into it like level/time/mode/premade status of play but I rarely see dodges in Blind pick. Even in ARAM I'll only see maybe 1 dodge out of 6-7~ games unless I'm having a really unlucky day.
___
As for no official Riot responses, there aren't very many OCE Rioters who have boards in their job description, and even fewer who's jobs involve actually posting (talking low single digits here) and they all have other things to do as well. The OCE Riot team is incredibly small and incredibly busy, which is why we started a volunteer program here, to address those concerns which the Rioters cannot. 

Autofill is something which they have addressed in the past, and have addressed in official global statements, so it's not something they can afford to spend too much time on. 

This: http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/F6a4bMs5-autofill-in-ranked-solo-q-for-lower-rank?comment=0003 is essentially the official statement on Autofill on OCE.
___
NCS is the new method of champion selection that was introduced with Dynamic queue last year (i.e role selection, the evolution of Team Builder). Like I said, no guarantees and no set timeline, but it's likely yes.
___
Autofill is on essentially whenever there is a small enough population of one role to create queue instability (in this case usually in the form of 40+ min queue times), which on a server as small as OCE, with now two queues to support, is pretty much always, Far too few people are willing to pick up support, and this is the end result.

Yeah autofill has it's problems, and yeah it sucks if you get filled into a role you can't play, but ultimately it's a problem that us as players created. We created this stigma that supports are useless, or only good for warding (despite the evidence otherwise), and get stuck in our "this is what this game is for and therefore the only way it should be played" meaning that support gets pushed aside since it doesn't fit that mold.

Autofill is a necessary evil until Riot can find a way to make support more appealing to the everyone else while still keeping the core values and not completely screwing over the support mains.

Autofill initally annoyed me aslo.  I used to be a support main in s5 though so getting autoed to supp doesnt bother me. I have taken the time to learn adc and jungle and can now fill thise autofills to. I those game i just resing not to carry and insted pick utility champs who help in teamfighta besr. 

If you"re really not comfortable in a role talk to your team. If its adc or jng they will normally trade. Having a competant player in those roles is important to everyone. 

What irks me are people who get autofilled to support and make no attempt to actually fill that role.  They make no attempt to buy income items. Take cs, roam and abondon the adc and never get wards. If your not gonna support dodge. Dont sink your team because your salty about autofill.

I agree with you that this is really annoying. Maybe at some point, Riot Games will make an option that you will get one of your chosen roles but you have to wait longer. Perhaps you could go post this on the NA forums, because that's where the dev teams seem to be, or send them a [support request](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and maybe at some point they'll do something about it because I know a lot of people agree with you. However, if it weren't for auto-fill in busy times we'd be waiting for 20 minutes just to get into a game, and maybe not even get your primary role, and not everyone has time for that.
